sn35.158:0.3: 158. Focus, the Interior, and the End of Relishing
sn35.158:1.1: “Mendicants, properly attend to the eye. Truly see the impermanence of the eye.
sn35.158:1.2: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with the eye.
sn35.158:1.3: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn35.158:1.5: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.
sn35.158:1.14: mind. Truly see the impermanence of the mind.
sn35.158:1.15: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with the mind.
sn35.158:1.16: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn35.158:1.18: When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.”
